title: Biden Seems Set on Making ‘Transitory’ Inflation Last
sub_head: He wants to feed demand while hoping workers get squeezed to avoid a 1970s-style wage-price spiral.
body:
Perhaps we shouldn’t be too hard on President Biden and Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell for insisting for months that inflation would be “transitory.”
While the word has come to be understood as denoting something short-lived, its literal meaning conveys more latitude: an event or condition that is temporary; something that eventually passes.
